Package com.zmicierk.webcrawler

Class WebCrawlerThread

java.lang.Object
com.zmicierk.webcrawler.WebCrawlerThread
public class WebCrawlerThread
extends java.lang.Object
This class is the core of the system. It implements all the crawling logic. The methods of this class perform the following tasks: Crawling web pages in accordance with a given depth and a limit on the number of visited pages, generating statistics for each of them, which is the number of occurrences of specified terms for each page that is processed during the craving process. Outputting statistics to a file, generating a file containing top pages with the maximum total number of occurrences of the specified terms and sorting by this parameter, also outputting these statistics to the standard output stream.

    private int exitStatus
    Defines the exit status: 0 Successful completion (no pages to process) 1 Successful completion (maximum depth(-d argument) reached) 2 Successful completion (page visit limit(-v argument) reached) -1 Unsuccessful completion

      The delay which determines the background tasks to wait for (in milliseconds) Used in waitForBackgroundJavaScriptStartingBefore This method blocks until all background JavaScript tasks scheduled to start executing before (now + timeOutJSBefore) have finished executing.

      The path to the CSV file in which top by total hits statistical data will be serialized (sorted by total hits). The number of entries in this file is specified in the numToPrintInTopFile parameter.

      The path to the CSV file in which all statistical data will be serialized (without predefined sorting)

      Determines whether to display the table heading in output files. true - display the table header false - do not display the table header

      Defines the search method: 0x80 (Pattern.CANON_EQ) - Case sensitive 0x02 (Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE) - Case insensitive

  • Constructor Details

    • WebCrawlerThread

      public WebCrawlerThread​(int maxVisited, int maxDepth, int timeOutJSBefore, int timeOutJS, int numToPrintInTopFile, int timeOut, java.lang.String topFileName, java.lang.String rawFileName, java.lang.String startUrl, java.lang.String termString, java.lang.String[] arOfTerms, boolean printHeader, boolean enableJS, boolean caseSensitive) throws java.lang.Exception
      It is used to initialize class fields in accordance with the specified arguments during the initialization process, the logical correctness of the passed arguments is checked, the start page is available and the files can be created.
      Parameters:
      maxVisited - The maximum number of pages to visit.
      maxDepth - The maximum number of transitions in depth relative to the initial page.
      timeOutJSBefore - The delay which determines the background tasks to wait for (in milliseconds) Used in waitForBackgroundJavaScriptStartingBefore This method blocks until all background JavaScript tasks scheduled to start executing before (now + timeOutJSBefore) have finished executing.
      timeOutJS - The maximum amount of time to wait (in milliseconds) Used in waitForBackgroundJavaScript This method blocks until all background JavaScript tasks have finished executing.
      numToPrintInTopFile - The number of records in the file specified in the topFileName parameter.
      timeOut - Time to wait for a response from the server.
      topFileName - The path to the CSV file in which top by total hits statistical data will be serialized (sorted by total hits). The number of entries in this file is specified in the numToPrintInTopFile parameter.
      rawFileName - The path to the CSV file in which all statistical data will be serialized (without predefined sorting)
      startUrl - URL from which the process starts its work.(seed)
      termString - A term string to define the number of occurrences per page. Terms are separated by commas.
      arOfTerms - An array of term strings to determine the number of occurrences per page.
      printHeader - Determines whether to display the table heading in output files. true - Display the table header false - Do not display the table header
      enableJS - Enables/disables JavaScript support.
      caseSensitive - If true, the search will be case sensitive.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - if the arguments passed are invalid.

  • Method Details

    • start

      public int start() throws java.lang.Exception
      Start WebCrawler process according to set class fields.
      Returns:
      exitStatus 0 Successful completion (no pages to process) 1 Successful completion (maximum depth(-d argument) reached) 2 Successful completion (page visit limit(-v argument) reached) -1 Unsuccessful completion
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - if something went wrong

    • parse

      void parse()
      Runs the countMatch function for each UrlQuaCur (List of pages to visit in current parse cycle) value. After traversing all links at the current level (UrlQuaCur is empty), it goes to the next level and transfers UrlQuaFormed (List of pages to visit in next parse cycle) to UrlQuaCur and then clears UrlQuaFormed. In the course of work, depth control is performed, adding the processed page to UrlArray (List of visited pages).

    • countMatch

      void countMatch​(java.lang.String url)
      This method searches for the specified terms on the page located at the passed url, passes the search results to the printToCSV method, and adds links from this page to the UrlQuaFormed if they are not contained in UrlArray, UrlQuaFormed and UrlQuaCur. Before adding, all links are reduced to a single form.
      Parameters:
      url - Link to the page to be processed.

    • printToCSV

      void printToCSV​(java.lang.String url, java.lang.String Matches)
      Outputs passed url and entries to csv file. Before writing, replaces commas with comma code in Percent-encoding. Initiates flushing data from the buffer to a file
      Parameters:
      url - url address (may contain commas)
      Matches - Comma separated string of occurrences

    • openRawCSV

      void openRawCSV() throws java.lang.Exception
      Captures a file for writing throughout the entire process.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - if having problems grabbing the file

    • getTopCSV

      void getTopCSV() throws java.lang.Exception
      Displays the specified number of URL addresses and entries for them in the csv file and in the standard output Stream, sorted by the total number of entries.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - if having problems grabbing the file

    • prepareCSV

      void prepareCSV​(java.lang.String fileName) throws java.lang.Exception
      Prepares the file passed as a parameter for writing. Rebuilds if file already exists, add table header if printHeader - true.
      Parameters:
      fileName - The path to the file to perform preparation.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - if having problems grabbing the file

    • checkFilePerm

      void checkFilePerm​(java.lang.String fileName) throws java.lang.Exception
      Checks if the file passed as a parameter can be written to.
      Parameters:
      fileName - The path to the file for which the writeability check is performed.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - If writing is not possible, or there is a problem while deleting the test file.
